content: Planning Area and HDB Estate in Central Region, Singapore **Marine Parade** is a [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) and [residential estate](/wiki/New_towns_of_Singapore) located on the eastern fringe of the [Central Region of Singapore](/wiki/Central_Region,_Singapore). Straddling the tip of the southeastern coast of [mainland Singapore](/wiki/Mainland_Singapore), Marine Parade serves as a buffer between the Central and [East](/wiki/East_Region,_Singapore) regions of the country. Bordering it are the planning areas of [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang) to the north, [Kallang](/wiki/Kallang) to the northwest, [Bedok](/wiki/Bedok) to the northeast, [Marina East](/wiki/Marina_East) to the southwest and the [Singapore Straits](/wiki/Singapore_Straits) to the south. Marine Parade is further divided into five subzones, East Coast, [Katong](/wiki/Katong), Marine Parade, Marina East (not to be confused with Marina East, the neighbouring planning area), and [Mountbatten](/wiki/Mountbatten,_Singapore). ## Background Marine Parade's early history can be associated with the precinct of [Katong](/wiki/Katong). Throughout the early to mid 20th century, the area was a haven for the wealthy [Peranakan](/wiki/Peranakan) community of Singapore. Katong witnessed a growth in Straits Chinese culture, developing a distinctive architecture style and even becoming the place of origin for the renowned [Katong Laksa](/wiki/Katong_Laksa) dish. Marine Parade, as it is known today, mainly consists of HDB (Housing Development Board) flats along the southernmost points of the estate. These were built in the 1970s after the reclamation of the island's east coast. Today, many private condominiums are also being built in the area.[*citation needed*] ## Administration Marine Parade has five [subzones](/wiki/List_of_subzones_in_Singapore), which are divisions of planning areas. These five are East Coast, [Katong](/wiki/Katong), Marine Parade, Marina East, and [Mountbatten](/wiki/Mountbatten,_Singapore). As of June 2024, Marine Parade is the most populous subzone at 27,140 residents whilst Marina East and East Coast are the least populous with 0 residents. ## Infrastructure The main public housing estate comprises 58 blocks of [HDB](/wiki/Housing_and_Development_Board) [flats](/wiki/Apartment). The public estate is bisected by the arterial Still Road South that provides access to the major highway, [East Coast Parkway](/wiki/East_Coast_Parkway), leading to the city area and to [Singapore Changi Airport](/wiki/Singapore_Changi_Airport).[*citation needed*] ### Transportation Marine Parade is served by four [Mass Rapid Transit](/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_(Singapore)) (MRT) stations on the [Thomsonâ€“East Coast line](/wiki/Thomson%E2%80%93East_Coast_Line). Two of them, [Marine Parade](/wiki/Marine_Parade_MRT_station) and [Tanjong Katong](/wiki/Tanjong_Katong_MRT_station), are directly in the planning area, whilst the other two, [Marine Terrace](/wiki/Marine_Terrace_MRT_station) and [Katong Park](/wiki/Katong_Park_MRT_station), are at its borders with other planning areas. ### Community Building The [Marine Parade Community Building](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Community_Building) was completed in 2000. It houses the Marine Parade Community Club and the [Marine Parade Public Library](/wiki/Marine_Parade_Public_Library). Other facilities within the three-storey complex include a 263-seater theatrette, a glass-walled gymnasium, a covered [basketball court](/wiki/Basketball_court) on the rooftop, an [air-conditioned](/wiki/Air_conditioning) and a sports hall. The building has since been demolished, and is receiving a major upgrade. ### Town centre Marine Parade, like other towns in Singapore, is served by a town centre. Dubbed Marine Parade Promenade, the centre itself consists of several neighbourhood shops, Parkway Centre and commercial complex namely [Parkway Parade](/wiki/Parkway_Parade) with integrates a shopping mall and office tower combined, and a new mall, iMall, located at the junction of Marine Parade Central.[*citation needed*] ## Education As Marine Parade is primarily either recreational or residential, it is also a host to a variety of schools. - Primary Schools - [CHIJ (Katong) Primary](/wiki/CHIJ_(Katong)_Primary) - Ngee Ann Primary School - [Tao Nan School](/wiki/Tao_Nan_School) - Haig Girls' School - [Tanjong Katong Primary School](/wiki/Tanjong_Katong_Primary_School) - Secondary Schools - [CHIJ Katong Convent](/wiki/CHIJ_Katong_Convent) - [St. Patrick's School](/wiki/St_Patrick%27s_School,_Singapore) - [Chung Cheng High School (Main)](/wiki/Chung_Cheng_High_School_(Main)) - [Tanjong Katong Secondary School](/wiki/Tanjong_Katong_Secondary_School) - [Tanjong Katong Girls' School](/wiki/Tanjong_Katong_Girls%27_School) - Junior Colleges - [Victoria Junior College](/wiki/Victoria_Junior_College) ## Politics Marine Parade is a component division of the [Mountbatten Single Member Constituency](/wiki/Mountbatten_Single_Member_Constituency), [Marine Parade-Braddell Heights Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/Marine_Parade-Braddell_Heights_Group_Representation_Constituency), and [East Coast Group Representation Constituency](/wiki/East_Coast_Group_Representation_Constituency) as of the 2025 election. The second and former Prime Minister [Goh Chok Tong](/wiki/Goh_Chok_Tong), represents Marine Parade since its formation in 1976 until his retirement in 2020. Currently, Marine Parade is represented by three MPs, with [Gho Sze Kee](/wiki/Gho_Sze_Kee) representing the westernmost areas under Mountbatten SMC, [Edwin Tong](/wiki/Edwin_Tong) who represents the easternmost areas and [Joo Chiat](/wiki/Joo_Chiat) in the neighbouring East Coast GRC, and [Goh Pei Ming](/wiki/Goh_Pei_Ming) for the majority of Marine Parade; his predecessor, Minister [Tan See Leng](/wiki/Tan_See_Leng), left there to contest [Chua Chu Kang GRC](/wiki/Chua_Chu_Kang_GRC) in 2025. ## Notable places - [Sea Breeze Lodge](/wiki/Sea_Breeze_Lodge), historical bungalow - Marine Parade Town Council
title: Marine Parade
